poi.description: The port makes an attractive destination but this walk is mostly about getting there and back by way of the semi-wild coastal slopes experiencing something of the local life on the way.
poi.refreshments: Bars, cafes, restaurants in Puntagorda.

images.caption: Puerto de Puntagorda
Approaching the port along PR LP 11.2
Descending to the slipway
Cave house in the cliffs

poi.name: El Pinar to Cuevas de Buraca
poi.short_description: Dragon trees, caves and a spectacular barranco.
poi.description: The traditional walk from near Las Tricias to Cuevas de Buraca but with an exploration of the impressive Barranco de Izcegua thrown in to make a long varied walk.
poi.refreshments: Bar and market at the start on weekends. Bars, restaurants, cafe, shops in El Pinar. Restaurant in Las Tricias. Cafe near the caves.
poi.route_file: LP19 El Pinar to Cuevas de Buraca

images.caption: Approaching Las Tricias
One of the best dragon trees on the island - on the GR130 path
Free-range chickens along the GR130
Cuevas de Buracas
Barranco de Izcegua

variants.description: The traditional easy circuit around Las Tricias to the caves passing one of the most famous and photogenic dragon tree groves on the way and a Gofio museum on the return leg.
variants.route_file: LP19a Las Tricias to Cuevas de Buraca

variants.description: An exploration of the impressive Barranco de Izcegua between Puntagorda and Las Tricias made possible by a newly constructed path.
variants.route_file: LP19b Barranco de Izcegua

poi.name: Tinizara to Tijarafe
poi.short_description: A gentle stroll through semi-domestic countryside.
poi.description: A popular and easy walk through pretty and varied countryside. Unchallenging but full of interest. Waypoint 06 ends the walk.
poi.refreshments: Bar/café in Tinizara. Bars, cafés, restaurants, shops in Tijarafe. Bar/café in El Jesús.

images.caption: Open views along the west coast
Cobbled camino section of the GR130

variants.description: The barranco is a good one and worth walking, perhaps after lunch in Tijarafe and then taking the bus to El Jesús to walk it in reverse.

poi.name: Pirates Bay
poi.short_description: Astonishing tiny cave community via an impressive barranco.
poi.description: A fairly long descent through the Barranco del Jurado and exposed cliff paths to a nice little beach community then up and over to Pirate’s Bay which is an astonishing hidden hamlet.
poi.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Tijirafe.

images.caption: Small community in the 'Pirates' Bay
Sheltered pool suitable for swimming
Tricky descent to the beach
Playa del Jorado
Inside the small self-contained community

dangers.details: The cliff path goes near the edge and is slippery with loose material.

variants.description: Walk 20 ends where this walk starts so combining them makes sense for those looking for a full day of walking.
variants.route_file: LP20 Tinizara to Tijarafe

variants.description: You can drive down to near the Porís de Candelaria, park up, and visit Pirates' Bay before walking the comparatively short distance over to the Playa del Jurado and back.

poi.name: Torre del Time
poi.short_description: Interesting but steep climb to the Barranco de las Angustias edge.
poi.description: A walk with a lot of steep climbing on a path rich in plants to reach the edge of the island’s largest barranco for great views. The way back takes a pretty forest path after visiting the tower.
poi.refreshments: Cervecería Isla Verde
poi.route_file: LP22b Torre del Time to Mirador El Time

images.caption: Barranco de las Angustias
Terraced vines on the north side of the barranco Angustias

dangers.details: Yappy loose dogs on the initial climb.

variants.description: Walk 22 with the initial climb subtracted.
A great stretch of (unmarked) linking path with stupendous views but for good weather only.
variants.route_file: LP22b Torre del Time to Mirador El Time

poi.name: Mirador El Time
poi.short_description: Crossing the Barranco de las Angustias with views all the way.
poi.description: After descending to the dry river bed there’s a steep climb up the opposite side but it’s perhaps not as bad as it looks. The mirador café provides refreshments then it’s down to another mirador with views of Puerto de Tazacorte followed by a steep but easy walk down to the beach.
poi.refreshments: Restaurant at Argual Abajo. Bar/café at Mirador El Time. Multiple bars, restaurants, cafés, shop in Puerto de Tazacorte.

images.caption: Los Llanos as seen from Miradoe El Time
Puerto de Tazacorte from Miradoe de la Punta
Los Llanos from Argual Abajo
Where the GR130 and GR131 cross over
Barranco de las Angustias from near the GR131 cross-over point

variants.description: You can easily make the climb to the viewing platform at the top from the beach – people do it in flip-flops – and it's a nice leg-stretcher if you're having a lazy beach day
Leave the car in the port and take the bus to the mirador and walk down.

poi.name: Roque de Muchachos to Refugio
poi.short_description: A spectacular two day hike along the Caldera rim.
poi.description: First half of a spectacular 2 day hike along the Caldera rim ending in a very basic but wonderfully sited refuge. Wonderful views all along with a few peaks (some rather windy) but none a difficult climb.
poi.refreshments: None
poi.route_file: LP24.1 Roque de Muchachos to Refugio

images.caption: Sunset over the clouds from Refugio Punta de los Roques
Lobelia growing near Roque de Muchachos
Pico de la Nieves
North side of the crest nearing the refugio
Late afternoon sun above the clouds on the GR131

dangers.details: Come prepared for mountainous conditions
Avoid in poor visibility
No phone signal or easy way off the mountain
Slippery conditions and obscured trail markers

variants.description: A short walk to another viewpoint along the Caldera crest.
Short walks to Pico de la Nieve or Mirador de los Andenes.
variants.directions: To Pico de la Nieve: [24.1](08 to 11) and back, To Mirador de los Andenes [24.1](08 to 02) and back

variants.description: Spectacular peak that can be climbed.
variants.route_file: LP24c Pico de la Nieve

variants.description: A shorter version of the 2-day route that can be done in a day with a taxi to the start.

poi.name: Refugio to Centro de Visitantes
poi.short_description: Day two of the best walk on the island.
poi.description: Second half of a spectacular two day hike along the Caldera rim. An easy and very beautiful descent along the Cumbre Nueva gradually changing from pine forest to laurisilva jungle as the clouds are entered. A steep descent then from the ridge followed by gentle country lanes
poi.refreshments: None
poi.route_file: LP24.2 Refugio to Centro de Visitantes

images.caption: The Cumbre Nueva under cloud with Pico Birigoyo peaking through
Dawn with El Tiede on Tenerife poking above the clouds

dangers.details: Come prepared for mountainous conditions
Avoid in poor visibility
No phone signal or easy way off the mountain
Slippery conditions and obscured trail markers

poi.name: Roque Palmero
poi.short_description: Explore away from the crowds along the Caldera crest.
poi.description: A walk from the main (crowded) viewing point along the Caldera rim down to another much less visited viewpoint.
poi.refreshments: None
poi.route_file: LP25 Roque de los Muchachos to Roque Palmero

images.caption: One of the many telescopes at the summit
Telescope cluster as seen from the GR131 path
The GR131 heading towards Puerto de Tazacorte
View from Roque Palmero

dangers.details: Come prepared for mountainous conditions
Avoid in poor visibility
No phone signal or easy way off the mountain
Slippery conditions and obscured trail markers

poi.name: Barranco de las Angustias
poi.short_description: Circuit through the Caldera interior.
poi.description: A classic hike through the largest barranco on the island. A shared taxi is needed to get to start viewpoint then it’s an easy forest walk down to the river and ‘beach’. The return route is rather more strenuous but still mostly downhill following the river bed or the higher-level path that continually crosses it.
poi.refreshments: None

images.caption: Looking north-east from Playa de Taburiente
View from Mirador Los Brecitos
Descending to the riverbed
Path soon after the campsite
Cascada de Colores
Near Dos Agua

variants.description: The walk up to the Cascada de Colores and back is a worthwhile alternative to the main walk. For variety you can follow the river all the way up and take the path on the way down when it offers an alternative.
Add-on walk to a waterfall for the very fit or those camping.
variants.route_file: LP26b Playa de Taburiente to Mirador Cascada de La Fondada

poi.name: La Cumbrecita
poi.short_description: Forest climb to the saddle point between the Caldera and Pico Bejenado.
poi.description: A lengthy though undemanding forest climb to the Cumbrecita viewpoints with a couple of good miradors on the way. After a circuit of the Cumbrecita viewpoints the way descends rather more easily on the road with opportunities to get off the road on to forest paths.
poi.refreshments: None

images.caption: Vista Cumbre Vieja
Path connecting the Cumbrecita to Pico Bejenado

variants.description: A good option if you're having a day off 'proper' walking but still want to stretch your legs. You need to book your parking slot in advance or arrive out of hours.
Taking a taxi to the top, completing a summit circuit, and then walking down the forest route is a popular choice.
If you are driving up to La Cumbrecita then you can make a proper walk of it by tacking on a side trip to Pico Bejenado. Allow enough time with some to spare when booking your parking permit.
variants.route_file: LP27d To Pico Bejenado and return to the visitor centre

variants.description: Taxi to the start, Cumbracita circuit, Pico Bejenado, and long walk down to the visitor centre.
variants.route_file: LP27d To Pico Bejenado and return to the visitor centre

poi.name: Pico Bejenado circuit
poi.short_description: Climb to the island's only true peak with far reaching views.
poi.description: A very picturesque circuit of the big volcano linking to La Cumbrecita. The views from on top are worth the sometimes steep climb but the whole circuit is a pleasant walk.
poi.refreshments: None

images.caption: view from Pico Bejenado looking towards Puerto Tazacorte
Caldera de Taburiente
Climbing to Pico Bejenado
Descending from Roque de Los Cuervos

variants.description: Taking a taxi to the start from the visitor centre lets you extend the walk by walking back down on PR LP 13.3
variants.route_file: LP28a Pista de Valencia to Centro de Visitantes

variants.description: Forest descent opening out to abandoned terraces and meadows near El Paso.
variants.route_file: LP28b Pista de Valencia to El Paso

poi.name: Llano de Jable
poi.short_description: An attractive open volcanic plane, a lava field and country lanes.
poi.description: A fairly lengthy forest climb to a lovely open area of volcanic sand and good views followed by an interesting descent through a lava field and an unsigned wander through country lanes.
poi.refreshments: None

images.caption: In the plains south of El Paso
Llanos de Jable
Crossing a lava field on PR LP 14
Bikers at the foot of Montaña Quemada (Volcán Tacande)

poi.name: Trans Cumbre
poi.short_description: Historic route over the Cumbre with views of both sides from the top.
poi.description: A transverse crossing of the Cumbre Nueva passing from country lanes to pine forest, clouds (probably), then dark and mossy cobbles and paths and finally to a more open wooded final stretch.
poi.refreshments: Bars, restaurants, cafés, shops in Breña Alta

images.caption: Where PR LP1 and the GR131 meet on the Cumbre Nueva
Small shrine in the forest on PR LP 1
Ermita de la Virgen del Pino

poi.name: Cumbre Nueva loop
poi.short_description: Long circuit that rewards with some fine views on a clear day.
poi.description: A big circuit climbing up to Refugio El Pilar, traversing the Cumbre Nueva, then descending steeply down back to the start.
poi.refreshments: Possible snack from kiosk at Refugio El Pilar

images.caption: Fayal-brezal (myrtl-heather) on the Cumbre Nueva
Radio mast along the GR131
View of the Caldera from the Cumbre Nueva
Country lane around Tacande

variants.description: With a car you can walk the Cumbre Nueva on its own following the forestry path in one direction and the GR 131 in the other.

poi.name: Lavas de San Juan
poi.short_description: Traverse of the most dramatic lava field on the island.
poi.description: An exploration of one of the most dramatic lava fields on the island with a scarily big (but well protected) hole to peer down into as well.
poi.refreshments: Bars/cafés in San Nicholas.

images.caption: Lavas de San Juan
Looking to the Cumbre Vieja from PR LP 14.1
Poppy lined PR LP 14.1 path

dangers.details: The lava field can cause nasty injuries if you trip.

poi.name: Montaña Marcos
poi.short_description: Peak with views and beautiful pine forest.
poi.description: A climb up to an interesting peak with good views and a nice easy section through the forest. If you’re lucky you may see paragliders taking off from a platform part way up.
poi.refreshments: Bar/café, pizza parlour, and a small shop in Jedy

images.caption: Unsigned but cairned path across the forest slope
View from Montaña Marcos
Montaña Marcos from near Jedy

dangers.details: Much of the route is off marked trails so GPS may have to be relied upon.

variants.description: To combine the walks without doing them individually you can use a short linking section of track that cuts out the less interesting descent from Montaña Marcos and joins the San Nicholas walk somewhere near Hoyo Grande. To complete the circuit a short easy section of the GR 130 is followed linking San Nicholas to Jedy.
variants.route_file: LP32 Lavas de San Juan
variants.directions: [33](01 to 14), then short linking track to [32], then [32](04 to 11) then GR 130 back to Jedy

poi.name: The Volcano Route
poi.short_description: Long but rewarding descent down the Cumbre Vieja.
poi.description: The classic hike along the volcanic spine of the island with multiple peak-bagging opportunities on the way. Great views all along and varied scenery ending in a descent through pine forest.
poi.refreshments: Mobile kiosk at the start. Bars, cafés, restaurants and shops in Los Canarios.

images.caption: View of the Caldera over the Aridane plain
Skirting Pico Birigoyo
The Malforda lava field and Volcán El Duraznero
Hoyo Negro
View of Tenerife from near Volcán de Martín

variants.description: After Pico Nambroque it's probably not much more effort to complete the whole walk rather than return to Refugio El Pilar. If you are just looking to avoid an expensive taxi ride back then you can go as far as Deseada before returning.
Fit walkers can complete the route 'properly' by finishing at the lighthouses.
variants.route_file: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses

poi.name: Pico Birigoyo circuit
poi.short_description: The 'real' volcano route that goes over the peaks.
poi.description: This walk takes the high line along the volcanic peaks. It’s an alternative to the first part of the Volcano Route which follows a lower line not climbing the peaks. Spectacular views but very windy. Finishes by looping back through pleasant easy tracks.
poi.refreshments: Mobile kiosk at Refugio El Pilar serves drinks and snacks.

images.caption: Approaching the peak of Volcan Birigoyo
Montaña la Barquita
Towards Montaña la Barquita
Near Pico Nambroque

poi.name: Volcán de Martín
poi.short_description: Colourful volcanic landscapes and wide ranging views.
poi.description: Starting from Área Recreativa Fuente Los Roques the walk goes through some lovely volcanic landscapes before climbing the volcano and descending by way of a lava field. Great views all along. The start requires a car to get to but you can also walk the last bit of the Volcano Route in reverse to reach the trail.
poi.refreshments: Bars, cafés and restaurants in Los Canarios

images.caption: Ascending Volcán de Martín
View from Volcán de Martín
Picon (black pea-gravel) path at the base of Volcán de Martín
Natural Bugloss rockery on SL FU 110

variants.description: Access for non-drivers by walking up from Los Canarios.
variants.route_file: LP34 The Volcano Route

poi.name: Volcan San Antonio
poi.short_description: A simple walk around Volcán San Antonio.
poi.description: An easy circuit of the volcano if you want something more than just the summit climb. Takes in some faint petroglyphs on the way.
poi.refreshments: Café in the visitor centre and a restaurant near the access road.

images.caption: Centro de Visitantes del San Antonio
Volcán de San Antonio
Path round crest of Volcán de San Antonio

variants.description: Add-on to climb the peak
variants.route_file: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses

poi.name: Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses
poi.short_description: Volcanic descent with peak-bagging opportunity.
poi.description: After circling Volcán San Antonio and climbing Volcán Teneguia (optional) the path descends through a volcanic wasteland to the lighthouses, salt pans and sea at the southern tip of the island.
poi.refreshments: Bars/cafés/restaurants and shops in Los Canarios. Café in the visitor centre, restaurant near the access road. Restaurant by the salt pans in Faro de Fuencaliente.
poi.route_file: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses

images.caption: New Faro de Fuencaliente with the old lighthouse (now a museum) behind
Climbing Volcán de Teneguía
Final crater rim walk to summit of Volcán de Teneguía
Descending from Volcán de Teneguía to the lighthouses
Salt pans next to the lighthouse

routes.name: Santa Cruz sugar mills
routes.short_description: Steep but varied walk passing historic sugar mills.
routes.description: A short but steep circuit passing out of town past attractive houses with views along the way, then descending past the historic water mills and back down into town.
routes.refreshments: Bar/Restaurants along LP-101 and at Las Nieves.
routes.route_file: LP01 Sugar mills of Santa Cruz

images.caption: Sugar mills near Santa Cruz
Iglesia de El Salvador, Plaza de España
Steep climb past colourful houses

dangers.details: Some vicious seeming dogs on the route, hopefully chained up.

variants.description: A fairly long and strenuous circuit taking in the best bits around Santa Cruz including a great viewpoint, a canal path through semi rural areas, the church at Las Nieves, a dry riverbed descent, and watermills.
variants.route_file: LP01a Santa Cruz highlights

routes.name: Mirador and waterways
routes.short_description: Varied and sightly adventurous loop.
routes.description: A varied walk taking in a spectacular viewpoint over Santa Cruz, a slightly adventurous walk along a water channel, a church with an important relic and a dried river bed full of big boulders. The walk ends at the ship museum.
routes.refreshments: Bars and restaurants at the start and end points and on the way at Velhoco and Las Nieves.

images.caption: View over Santa Cruz from Mirador de la Concepción
Canal de Breña, covered waterway
Barranco de las Nieves (dried river bed)
Castillo de La Virgen, at the walk finish
Museo Naval (ship museum), at the walk finish

dangers.details: Vegetation can obscure missing or broken tiles covering the canal.

routes.name: Woods and springs
routes.short_description: Chestnut and pine forest with small shrines at the many springs.
routes.description: A pleasant forest walk with interest along the way from the many springs (most dry) and their sometimes fanciful and ornate decorative shrines.
routes.refreshments: Bars and restaurants in San Pedro de Breña Alta.

images.caption: One of the small shrines along the Camino de las Fuentes
Ancient washing basins near the walk start
Chestnut forest with many other species mixed in

variants.description: Walk 2 picks up where this walk leaves off so if you do this walk in the morning then after a lunch in the plaza you can finish the day by walking down to Santa Cruz initially following walk 2 then taking whichever route takes your fancy.
variants.route_file: LP02 Mirador and waterways

routes.name: Barranco de Mediera
routes.short_description: Daring walk through tunnels along a precipitous cliff edge.
routes.description: An adventurous barranco walk. The route climbs up the steep-sided barranco before turning round and returning on a spectacular and highly vertiginous route high up the rock face passing through tunnels and along a narrow gallery path with a sheer drop to the side before gradually becoming a more normal forest descent along switchbacks.
routes.refreshments: Bar/Restaurant at Las Nieves.

images.caption: Gallery tunnel
The gallery path has partial protection from the steep drops
View into the valley from up high
View over Santa Cruz on the descent

dangers.details: Narrow crumbling precipitous path. There have been many injuries and even deaths.
Risk of clouting head

routes.name: Puntallana to Los Sauces
routes.short_description: East coast walk that dips down to the sea.
routes.description: A long coastal walk along the only stretch of the GR 130 that actually goes close to the sea. Includes some lengthy stretches through dull banana plantations and a steep climb up to Los Sauces. Option to extend to the sea pools of Charco Azul.
routes.refreshments: Bars, café, restaurant in Puntallana. Bar & restaurant in San Andrés. Bars, cafés, restaurants in Los Sauces.

images.caption: Cliff view along the GR130
Jacaranda tree at the Fuente de San Juan
The only place where the GR130 actually meets the sea

routes.name: El Cubo de La Galga
routes.short_description: Popular walk through laurisilva forest with a nature trail for kids.
routes.description: An easily accessed circuit through laurisilva jungle of high quality. Nearby restaurants and extension loops mean you can tailor your day easily.
routes.refreshments: None en route. Restaurant on PR LP 5 intersection with LP-1 road (walk 6b).

images.caption: Small viaduct in the laurisilva forest.
Deep in the laurisilva forest
Mirador Somada Alta
Caves along the PR LP 5 variant route

variants.description: The first road and track part of the walk can be done as an easy self-guided tour (free leaflet from the information office) suitable for children. The leaflet text is linked to numbered points along the trail.

For a full day's walk that maybe incorporates a restaurant break on the way you can split from the main walk and follow the PR LP 5 all the way down to the coast along the terrific Barranco hondo de Nogales then loop back up to rejoin the original walk following PR LP 5.1.
variants.route_file: LP06b Cubo La Galga coastal extension

routes.name: Los Tilos Bridge
routes.short_description: Short exploration of the Los Tilos gorge and bridge.
routes.description: A nice little circuit on a protected pedestrian walkway that lets you fully appreciate the bridge and the gorge it spans.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Los Sauces.

images.caption: Los Tilos Bridge
Nuestra Senora de Montserrat (church), Los Sauces

variants.description: To see the bridge form all angles and both sides take the concrete path that leads down into the gorge and under the bridge (clearly visible from on top). Climb steeply out to the end of the bridge.
variants.directions: [06](01 to 02) then follow the track down under the bridge and out the other side.

routes.name: La Laguna
routes.short_description: Laurisilva forest walk with well-regarded restaurant stop.
routes.description: A steep climb leads into the protected laurisilva forest before descending to the rather dull lagoon. From there the way descends back to the road and traverses a couple of barrancos before circling back to the town.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Los Sauces. Bar/restaurant at Laguna de Barlovento.

images.caption: Sunny glade in the laurisilva forest.
Mirador de las Barandas
Looking up the Los Tilos valley

routes.name: Marcos y Cordero Springs
routes.short_description: Exciting downhill through tunnels to the springs.
routes.description: A classic walk through numerous (wet) tunnels and a high gallery path to the impressive springs. The descent begins steeply with a semi-scramble down a boulder-filled river bed before becoming a more normal path down the gorge changing from pine forest to laurisilva jungle ending up near the Los Tilos visitor centre. 4WD shared taxi or tour is required to reach the start.
routes.refreshments: Bar, café, restaurant Los Tilos Visitor Centre.

images.caption: Marcos y Cordero Springs
Narrow gallery path approaching the tunnels
Springs after the tunnels
Cascada De Los Tilos (walk 9c)
Some big boulders to negotiate on the descent

variants.description: A good short walk is to do just the last part of the route in reverse as far as the mirador (perhaps also a little further on as far as the first bridge). It's a very worthwhile laurisilva forest walk with a good viewpoint as reward.

Fit walkers can do the walk in reverse up to the springs and then come back the same way saving the taxi fare. It's really a very long climb up though. The full walk to Casa del Monte and down again will be too much for all but the fittest.
There's a man-made waterfall near the visitor centre that's beautifully framed and worth visiting. It's only turned on though when there's enough water.
variants.directions: Take the signed side trail between the taxi hut and the visitor centre

routes.name: Barlovento to Franceses
routes.short_description: Beautiful coastal walk with some large barrancos.
routes.description: Long acknowledged as one of the most attractive sections of path on the island, this classic walk is a succession of wonderful far-reaching views along the coast punctuated by explorations into the barrancos and wanderings through the scattered villages and small farms on the way. It's a fairly short and easy walk as far as Gallegos but the final barranco to Franceses is something else again and will consume about a third of your time.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Barlovento. Bar/shop and bar in Gallegos.

images.caption: La Tosca has a small dragon tree grove
The approach to Gallegos
Branch route leading to the sea
Side branch descent to a beach

variants.description: The bus stops at Gallegos so you can halt the walk there if you don't fancy going all the way.
The walk to Gallegos is short enough for a there-and back walk which would be justified given the attractiveness of the path.

routes.name: Franceses to Santo Domingo
routes.short_description: Superb coastal scenery with two large barrancos.
routes.description: One of the best stretches of coast on the island. There are a couple of large barrancos at the start that are full of interest but will take time to traverse.
routes.refreshments: Bar in El Tablado. Bars, cafés and restaurants in Santo Domingo.

images.caption: Unspoilt coastal scenery east of Garafia
Barranco de los Hombres, approaching El Tablado
Wind turbines near Juan Adalid

variants.description: If the whole walk seems too long you could call it a day early and get a taxi from Don Pedro
You can choose to walk either barranco and get a look into the other without walking it.
variants.directions: [11](05 to 01) and back or [11](05 to 07) and back

routes.name: Big northern loop
routes.short_description: Some of the best coastal scenery and laurasilva forest.
routes.description: A long and very rewarding walk that needs an early start in the winter. The first section is a steep climb up to the La Zarza museum. You then descend into fabulous laurisilva forest before emerging on the coast for the final very scenic leg.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Santo Domingo. Restaurant in La Mata.

images.caption: Mirador on the path heading up to La Zarza
Great dragon tree on path PL LP 9.3 approaching Garafia
A seeming dead-end in the Barranco de Fagundo

variants.description: The walk can be made more manageable by taking the bus to La Zarza.

routes.name: Puerto de Garafia
routes.short_description: A beautiful and very varied walk that is full of interest.
routes.description: A rather long but richly rewarding loop in three stages. The first leg is steeply up through pine forest to Llano Negro, then down through mixed landscapes to the attractive port and finally the coastal section leading back in to town.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Santo Domingo. Bar/cafe in Llano Negro.

images.caption: Puerto de Garafia
Geodesic dome dwelling just off the path to the port
Fisherman shacks at the port
Ancient Guanches petroglyphs between the port and Garafia
Farmland on the approach to Llano Negro

variants.description: The walk can be downgraded to a moderate effort level by taking the bus to Llano Negro and starting from there.
Enjoy the port at its best by taking a slow late afternoon stroll down. Stay for the sunset but remember to bring a torch (and perhaps insect repellent).

routes.name: Bosque Dragos El Palmar
routes.short_description: Lovely little circuit to impressive dragon trees.
routes.description: A very pleasant short walk along some attractive coast to a little known dragon tree grove. The descent is down a steep cobbled track.
routes.refreshments: Bars/cafés/restaurants in Santo Domingo.

images.caption: Isolated house in a dragon tree grove

routes.name: Caldera de Agua
routes.short_description: Dark and mysterious laurisilva forest walk with picnic opportunities.
routes.description: A visit to the museum at La Zarza goes well with this little circuit that descends through deep dark laurisilva forest encountering several mini calderas on the way. The path exits the forest and completes the loop by way of a large recreation ground with good BBQ facilities.
routes.refreshments: Restaurant at La Mata. Bar/café in Llano Negro bus station. Picnic/BBQ facilities at San Antonio del Monte recreational area.

images.caption: Dried-up waterfall
Descending to the riverbed
Fuente de la Caldera del Agua

routes.name: Laurisilva forest loop
routes.short_description: A longer version of walk 15 that goes down to the coast.
routes.description: A long descent through some of the finest laurisilva forest on the island to the coast where there are spectacular views before a return on a different but parallel path.
routes.refreshments: Restaurant at La Mata. Bar/cafe in Llano Negro bus station.

images.caption: Ascending from the Mirador de la Calzada
Last of the barranco views before heading into the forest
Entering the laurisilva forest

variants.description: For a shorter version that keeps all the good bits of the Caldera de Agua but looses the coast and barranco views it's possible to take a shortcut on a well signed small road about half way down.
variants.directions: [16](01 to 10) then signed shortcut, then [16](20 to 22)

variants.description: An alternative finish is to keep on the GR 130 after Mirador la Calzada and walk the two spectacular barrancos to Franceses and catch the bus back.
variants.route_file: LP11 Franceses to Santo Domingo

routes.name: Around Puntagorda
routes.short_description: Varied and beautiful walk around the semi-rural bits of Puntagorda.
routes.description: A delightful circuit around Puntagorda with great variety taking in an iconic dragon tree, giant vegetation, and lovely views of the semi-rural countryside.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Puntagorda.

images.caption: Iglesia San Mauro de Abad
Looking across the lower reaches of Puntagorda
PR LP 11.1 near El Roque
Mirador de los Dragos

variants.description: From El roque you could visit the two miradors and then explore as far as the end of the pine forest zone before returning the same way.

routes.name: Puerto de Puntagorda
routes.short_description: A walk to a port through the local countryside.
routes.description: The port makes an attractive destination but this walk is mostly about getting there and back by way of the semi-wild coastal slopes experiencing something of the local life on the way.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafes, restaurants in Puntagorda.

images.caption: Puerto de Puntagorda
Approaching the port along PR LP 11.2
Descending to the slipway
Cave house in the cliffs

routes.name: El Pinar to Cuevas de Buraca
routes.short_description: Dragon trees, caves and a spectacular barranco.
routes.description: The traditional walk from near Las Tricias to Cuevas de Buraca but with an exploration of the impressive Barranco de Izcegua thrown in to make a long varied walk.
routes.refreshments: Bar and market at the start on weekends. Bars, restaurants, cafe, shops in El Pinar. Restaurant in Las Tricias. Cafe near the caves.
routes.route_file: LP19 El Pinar to Cuevas de Buraca

images.caption: Approaching Las Tricias
One of the best dragon trees on the island - on the GR130 path
Free-range chickens along the GR130
Cuevas de Buracas
Barranco de Izcegua

variants.description: The traditional easy circuit around Las Tricias to the caves passing one of the most famous and photogenic dragon tree groves on the way and a Gofio museum on the return leg.
variants.route_file: LP19a Las Tricias to Cuevas de Buraca

variants.description: An exploration of the impressive Barranco de Izcegua between Puntagorda and Las Tricias made possible by a newly constructed path.
variants.route_file: LP19b Barranco de Izcegua

routes.name: Tinizara to Tijarafe
routes.short_description: A gentle stroll through semi-domestic countryside.
routes.description: A popular and easy walk through pretty and varied countryside. Unchallenging but full of interest. Waypoint 06 ends the walk.
routes.refreshments: Bar/café in Tinizara. Bars, cafés, restaurants, shops in Tijarafe. Bar/café in El Jesús.

images.caption: Open views along the west coast
Cobbled camino section of the GR130

variants.description: The barranco is a good one and worth walking, perhaps after lunch in Tijarafe and then taking the bus to El Jesús to walk it in reverse.

routes.name: Pirates Bay
routes.short_description: Astonishing tiny cave community via an impressive barranco.
routes.description: A fairly long descent through the Barranco del Jurado and exposed cliff paths to a nice little beach community then up and over to Pirate’s Bay which is an astonishing hidden hamlet.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Tijirafe.

images.caption: Small community in the 'Pirates' Bay
Sheltered pool suitable for swimming
Tricky descent to the beach
Playa del Jorado
Inside the small self-contained community

dangers.details: The cliff path goes near the edge and is slippery with loose material.

variants.description: Walk 20 ends where this walk starts so combining them makes sense for those looking for a full day of walking.
variants.route_file: LP20 Tinizara to Tijarafe

variants.description: You can drive down to near the Porís de Candelaria, park up, and visit Pirates' Bay before walking the comparatively short distance over to the Playa del Jurado and back.

routes.name: Torre del Time
routes.short_description: Interesting but steep climb to the Barranco de las Angustias edge.
routes.description: A walk with a lot of steep climbing on a path rich in plants to reach the edge of the island’s largest barranco for great views. The way back takes a pretty forest path after visiting the tower.
routes.refreshments: Cervecería Isla Verde
routes.route_file: LP22b Torre del Time to Mirador El Time

images.caption: Barranco de las Angustias
Terraced vines on the north side of the barranco Angustias

dangers.details: Yappy loose dogs on the initial climb.

variants.description: Walk 22 with the initial climb subtracted.
A great stretch of (unmarked) linking path with stupendous views but for good weather only.
variants.route_file: LP22b Torre del Time to Mirador El Time

routes.name: Mirador El Time
routes.short_description: Crossing the Barranco de las Angustias with views all the way.
routes.description: After descending to the dry river bed there’s a steep climb up the opposite side but it’s perhaps not as bad as it looks. The mirador café provides refreshments then it’s down to another mirador with views of Puerto de Tazacorte followed by a steep but easy walk down to the beach.
routes.refreshments: Restaurant at Argual Abajo. Bar/café at Mirador El Time. Multiple bars, restaurants, cafés, shop in Puerto de Tazacorte.

images.caption: Los Llanos as seen from Miradoe El Time
Puerto de Tazacorte from Miradoe de la Punta
Los Llanos from Argual Abajo
Where the GR130 and GR131 cross over
Barranco de las Angustias from near the GR131 cross-over point

variants.description: You can easily make the climb to the viewing platform at the top from the beach – people do it in flip-flops – and it's a nice leg-stretcher if you're having a lazy beach day
Leave the car in the port and take the bus to the mirador and walk down.

routes.name: Roque de Muchachos to Refugio
routes.short_description: A spectacular two day hike along the Caldera rim.
routes.description: First half of a spectacular 2 day hike along the Caldera rim ending in a very basic but wonderfully sited refuge. Wonderful views all along with a few peaks (some rather windy) but none a difficult climb.
routes.refreshments: None
routes.route_file: LP24.1 Roque de Muchachos to Refugio

images.caption: Sunset over the clouds from Refugio Punta de los Roques
Lobelia growing near Roque de Muchachos
Pico de la Nieves
North side of the crest nearing the refugio
Late afternoon sun above the clouds on the GR131

dangers.details: Come prepared for mountainous conditions
Avoid in poor visibility
No phone signal or easy way off the mountain
Slippery conditions and obscured trail markers

variants.description: A short walk to another viewpoint along the Caldera crest.
Short walks to Pico de la Nieve or Mirador de los Andenes.
variants.directions: To Pico de la Nieve: [24.1](08 to 11) and back, To Mirador de los Andenes [24.1](08 to 02) and back

variants.description: Spectacular peak that can be climbed.
variants.route_file: LP24c Pico de la Nieve

variants.description: A shorter version of the 2-day route that can be done in a day with a taxi to the start.

routes.name: Refugio to Centro de Visitantes
routes.short_description: Day two of the best walk on the island.
routes.description: Second half of a spectacular two day hike along the Caldera rim. An easy and very beautiful descent along the Cumbre Nueva gradually changing from pine forest to laurisilva jungle as the clouds are entered. A steep descent then from the ridge followed by gentle country lanes
routes.refreshments: None
routes.route_file: LP24.2 Refugio to Centro de Visitantes

images.caption: The Cumbre Nueva under cloud with Pico Birigoyo peaking through
Dawn with El Tiede on Tenerife poking above the clouds

dangers.details: Come prepared for mountainous conditions
Avoid in poor visibility
No phone signal or easy way off the mountain
Slippery conditions and obscured trail markers

routes.name: Roque Palmero
routes.short_description: Explore away from the crowds along the Caldera crest.
routes.description: A walk from the main (crowded) viewing point along the Caldera rim down to another much less visited viewpoint.
routes.refreshments: None
routes.route_file: LP25 Roque de los Muchachos to Roque Palmero

images.caption: One of the many telescopes at the summit
Telescope cluster as seen from the GR131 path
The GR131 heading towards Puerto de Tazacorte
View from Roque Palmero

dangers.details: Come prepared for mountainous conditions
Avoid in poor visibility
No phone signal or easy way off the mountain
Slippery conditions and obscured trail markers

routes.name: Barranco de las Angustias
routes.short_description: Circuit through the Caldera interior.
routes.description: A classic hike through the largest barranco on the island. A shared taxi is needed to get to start viewpoint then it’s an easy forest walk down to the river and ‘beach’. The return route is rather more strenuous but still mostly downhill following the river bed or the higher-level path that continually crosses it.
routes.refreshments: None

images.caption: Looking north-east from Playa de Taburiente
View from Mirador Los Brecitos
Descending to the riverbed
Path soon after the campsite
Cascada de Colores
Near Dos Agua

variants.description: The walk up to the Cascada de Colores and back is a worthwhile alternative to the main walk. For variety you can follow the river all the way up and take the path on the way down when it offers an alternative.
Add-on walk to a waterfall for the very fit or those camping.
variants.route_file: LP26b Playa de Taburiente to Mirador Cascada de La Fondada

routes.name: La Cumbrecita
routes.short_description: Forest climb to the saddle point between the Caldera and Pico Bejenado.
routes.description: A lengthy though undemanding forest climb to the Cumbrecita viewpoints with a couple of good miradors on the way. After a circuit of the Cumbrecita viewpoints the way descends rather more easily on the road with opportunities to get off the road on to forest paths.
routes.refreshments: None

images.caption: Vista Cumbre Vieja
Path connecting the Cumbrecita to Pico Bejenado

variants.description: A good option if you're having a day off 'proper' walking but still want to stretch your legs. You need to book your parking slot in advance or arrive out of hours.
Taking a taxi to the top, completing a summit circuit, and then walking down the forest route is a popular choice.
If you are driving up to La Cumbrecita then you can make a proper walk of it by tacking on a side trip to Pico Bejenado. Allow enough time with some to spare when booking your parking permit.
variants.route_file: LP27d To Pico Bejenado and return to the visitor centre

variants.description: Taxi to the start, Cumbracita circuit, Pico Bejenado, and long walk down to the visitor centre.
variants.route_file: LP27d To Pico Bejenado and return to the visitor centre

routes.name: Pico Bejenado circuit
routes.short_description: Climb to the island's only true peak with far reaching views.
routes.description: A very picturesque circuit of the big volcano linking to La Cumbrecita. The views from on top are worth the sometimes steep climb but the whole circuit is a pleasant walk.
routes.refreshments: None

images.caption: view from Pico Bejenado looking towards Puerto Tazacorte
Caldera de Taburiente
Climbing to Pico Bejenado
Descending from Roque de Los Cuervos

variants.description: Taking a taxi to the start from the visitor centre lets you extend the walk by walking back down on PR LP 13.3
variants.route_file: LP28a Pista de Valencia to Centro de Visitantes

variants.description: Forest descent opening out to abandoned terraces and meadows near El Paso.
variants.route_file: LP28b Pista de Valencia to El Paso

routes.name: Llano de Jable
routes.short_description: An attractive open volcanic plane, a lava field and country lanes.
routes.description: A fairly lengthy forest climb to a lovely open area of volcanic sand and good views followed by an interesting descent through a lava field and an unsigned wander through country lanes.
routes.refreshments: None

images.caption: In the plains south of El Paso
Llanos de Jable
Crossing a lava field on PR LP 14

routes.name: Trans Cumbre
routes.short_description: Historic route over the Cumbre with views of both sides from the top.
routes.description: A transverse crossing of the Cumbre Nueva passing from country lanes to pine forest, clouds (probably), then dark and mossy cobbles and paths and finally to a more open wooded final stretch.
routes.refreshments: Bars, restaurants, cafés, shops in Breña Alta

images.caption: Where PR LP1 and the GR131 meet on the Cumbre Nueva
Small shrine in the forest on PR LP 1
Ermita de la Virgen del Pino

routes.name: Cumbre Nueva loop
routes.short_description: Long circuit that rewards with some fine views on a clear day.
routes.description: A big circuit climbing up to Refugio El Pilar, traversing the Cumbre Nueva, then descending steeply down back to the start.
routes.refreshments: Possible snack from kiosk at Refugio El Pilar

images.caption: Fayal-brezal (myrtl-heather) on the Cumbre Nueva
Radio mast along the GR131
View of the Caldera from the Cumbre Nueva
Country lane around Tacande

variants.description: With a car you can walk the Cumbre Nueva on its own following the forestry path in one direction and the GR 131 in the other.

routes.name: Lavas de San Juan
routes.short_description: Traverse of the most dramatic lava field on the island.
routes.description: An exploration of one of the most dramatic lava fields on the island with a scarily big (but well protected) hole to peer down into as well.
routes.refreshments: Bars/cafés in San Nicholas.

images.caption: Lavas de San Juan
Looking to the Cumbre Vieja from PR LP 14.1
Poppy lined PR LP 14.1 path

dangers.details: The lava field can cause nasty injuries if you trip.

routes.name: Montaña Marcos
routes.short_description: Peak with views and beautiful pine forest.
routes.description: A climb up to an interesting peak with good views and a nice easy section through the forest. If you’re lucky you may see paragliders taking off from a platform part way up.
routes.refreshments: Bar/café, pizza parlour, and a small shop in Jedy

images.caption: Unsigned but cairned path across the forest slope
View from Montaña Marcos
Montaña Marcos from near Jedy

dangers.details: Much of the route is off marked trails so GPS may have to be relied upon.

variants.description: To combine the walks without doing them individually you can use a short linking section of track that cuts out the less interesting descent from Montaña Marcos and joins the San Nicholas walk somewhere near Hoyo Grande. To complete the circuit a short easy section of the GR 130 is followed linking San Nicholas to Jedy.
variants.route_file: LP32 Lavas de San Juan
variants.directions: [33](01 to 14), then short linking track to [32], then [32](04 to 11) then GR 130 back to Jedy

routes.name: The Volcano Route
routes.short_description: Long but rewarding descent down the Cumbre Vieja.
routes.description: The classic hike along the volcanic spine of the island with multiple peak-bagging opportunities on the way. Great views all along and varied scenery ending in a descent through pine forest.
routes.refreshments: Mobile kiosk at the start. Bars, cafés, restaurants and shops in Los Canarios.

images.caption: View of the Caldera over the Aridane plain
Skirting Pico Birigoyo
The Malforda lava field and Volcán El Duraznero
Hoyo Negro
View of Tenerife from near Volcán de Martín

variants.description: After Pico Nambroque it's probably not much more effort to complete the whole walk rather than return to Refugio El Pilar. If you are just looking to avoid an expensive taxi ride back then you can go as far as Deseada before returning.
Fit walkers can complete the route 'properly' by finishing at the lighthouses.
variants.route_file: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses

routes.name: Pico Birigoyo circuit
routes.short_description: The 'real' volcano route that goes over the peaks.
routes.description: This walk takes the high line along the volcanic peaks. It’s an alternative to the first part of the Volcano Route which follows a lower line not climbing the peaks. Spectacular views but very windy. Finishes by looping back through pleasant easy tracks.
routes.refreshments: Mobile kiosk at Refugio El Pilar serves drinks and snacks.

images.caption: Approaching the peak of Volcan Birigoyo
Montaña la Barquita
Towards Montaña la Barquita
Near Pico Nambroque

routes.name: Volcán de Martín
routes.short_description: Colourful volcanic landscapes and wide ranging views.
routes.description: Starting from Área Recreativa Fuente Los Roques the walk goes through some lovely volcanic landscapes before climbing the volcano and descending by way of a lava field. Great views all along. The start requires a car to get to but you can also walk the last bit of the Volcano Route in reverse to reach the trail.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés and restaurants in Los Canarios

images.caption: Ascending Volcán de Martín
View from Volcán de Martín
Picon (black pea-gravel) path at the base of Volcán de Martín
Natural Bugloss rockery on SL FU 110

variants.description: Access for non-drivers by walking up from Los Canarios.
variants.route_file: LP34 The Volcano Route

routes.name: Volcan San Antonio
routes.short_description: A simple walk around Volcán San Antonio.
routes.description: An easy circuit of the volcano if you want something more than just the summit climb. Takes in some faint petroglyphs on the way.
routes.refreshments: Café in the visitor centre and a restaurant near the access road.

images.caption: Centro de Visitantes del San Antonio
Volcán de San Antonio
Path round crest of Volcán de San Antonio

variants.description: Add-on to climb the peak
variants.route_file: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses

routes.name: Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses
routes.short_description: Volcanic descent with peak-bagging opportunity.
routes.description: After circling Volcán San Antonio and climbing Volcán Teneguia (optional) the path descends through a volcanic wasteland to the lighthouses, salt pans and sea at the southern tip of the island.
routes.refreshments: Bars/cafés/restaurants and shops in Los Canarios. Café in the visitor centre, restaurant near the access road. Restaurant by the salt pans in Faro de Fuencaliente.
routes.route_file: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses

Climbing Volcán de Teneguía
Final crater rim walk to summit of Volcán de Teneguía
Descending from Volcán de Teneguía to the lighthouses
